docs.snippet: Alan Anderson is one of five Nets players making his N.B.A. postseason debut, but during a nine-year professional career, he has played for teams in eight countries....
docs.lead_paragraph: Alan Anderson is one of five Nets players making his N.B.A. postseason debut, but during a nine-year professional career, he has played for teams in eight countries.
docs.abstract: Brooklyn Nets guard Alan Anderson is one of five players on roster making his NBA postseason debut, but during a nine-year professional career, he has played for teams in eight countries and may be one of the most battle-tested and decorated players on the team.

headline.main: Nets’ Anderson Has World of Experience in Pressure Situations
headline.print_headline: Nets’ Anderson Has World of Experience in Pressure Situations

docs.snippet: The Knicks have fired another head coach, and to this we may all shrug and say, What else is new?...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Knicks have fired another head coach, and to this we may all shrug and say, What else is new?
docs.abstract: Harvey Araton On Pro Basketball column holds that New York Knicks continue to spin revolving door of coaches with dismissal of Mike Woodson; since Red Holzman’s first tour of bench duty produced the franchise’s only two championships, in 1970 and 1973, 18 coaches have come and gone.

headline.main: Another Coach Spun Out the Garden’s Revolving Door
headline.print_headline: The Revolving Door Takes Another Spin

docs.snippet: Red Holzman and his two N.B.A. titles cast a long shadow over the roster of coaches who tried, and failed, to lift the Knicks to the top....
docs.lead_paragraph: Red Holzman and his two N.B.A. titles cast a long shadow over the roster of coaches who tried, and failed, to lift the Knicks to the top.

headline.main: Spotlight Illuminated Some Knicks Coaches but Singed Others

docs.abstract: Analysis; New York Knicks firing of coach Mike Woodson caps a season of unmet expectations.

headline.main: Knicks Fire Mike Woodson as Coach

docs.snippet: A nonprofit group surprises Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey — and his four children — with an award that dates to the 1940s....
docs.lead_paragraph: A nonprofit group surprises Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey — and his four children — with an award that dates to the 1940s.
docs.abstract: Nonprofit group, Father’s Day-Mother’s Day Council, names New Jersey Gov Chris Christie Father of the Year; father of four, who has woven tales of his family’s dinner conversations, his daughter’s basketball practice and his son’s college admissions into the fabric of his governorship, seems genuinely moved by the honor.

headline.main: When It Comes to Fatherhood, It Seems Christie Knows Best
headline.print_headline: An Early Father’s Day Gift Is Awarded to Christie
